REVIEW: Jun 29 2009 	Excellent Hotel in the Heart of the City	My teenagers actually said that this hotel has spoiled them for other hotels. Not a bad review from cynical teenagers.The hotel was up scale in the middle of Times Square and as purchased through the Name-Your-Price feature at Priceline...was a very good value. The room was comfortable and quiet.

Jun 29 2009 	New York Marriott Marquis is a Great Hotel!!!	Just wrapped up a two day stay at this wonderful hotel and wish I could have stayed longer! Check-in a breeze, clean, beautiful room with comfy bed. One thing I can say is that when they say they are in the heart of the theater district - they really are! On the downside, the pricing at the hotel resaurants wasa bit steep. A simple breakfast for one averaged $50. Juniors, a great restaurant for breakfast, lunch and dinner, is right across the street was a great alternative. A short walk to John Pizzaria, Carmine's and Sardi's, as well as Rstaurant Row. Be sure to give Becco's on Restaurnat Row a try for great italian. In all, I can't speak highly enough of this hotel and we will be back!

Jun 28 2009 	GREAT SERVICE GREAT LOCATION WOULD STAY HERE AGAIN	I arrived at around 7:45 pm at the hotel, with my fiance from La Guardia Airport. It was a long trip for us, so we were exhausted and excited at the same time, since this was our first time to New York.As soon as we got out of our shuttle, at the street level of our hotel, a very gentle empoyee approached us and took care of our luggage, he gave us some tickets for the luggage, and told us that they would take it to our room, once we got a room assignated, and instructed us to go to the front desk located at the 8th floor.Elevator wait, was 2 minutes, using a very easy system (14 elevators, each one marked with a letter from A to N. In the middle, two buttons pannels, you put your floor number, the pannel tells you wich elevator to take. That`s it)When we got to the front desk, i handed my reservation to a very gentle lady, who checked it and said everything was in place. I asked her if it was possible to change the room, from a double bed room, to a king size bed room, since one of my party traveller couldn`t make it to new york.She did it in just one minute, and gave us a better room with a Times Square view, at the same rate i had booked.The room was spacious and clean. The view was stunning. Five minutes laters, the luggage arrived in the same conditions i left it in the street level, and it is fair to say that i was at the 30th floor.Internet access worked perfect. It is possible to pay for a cable access or if you have a laptop you could get the wireless connection at no cost.We went several times to the concierge level, to ask for information about addreses and restaurants, and broadway shows, and everytime they were helpful.The location of this hotel is absolutely a major benefit. Everything is in walking distance, and if it`s not then you have several bus stops and subway stations nearby, to take you everywhere.Check out time is 12:00 pm. And our flight to Miami was at 6:45 pm. So we have to options: 1. Ask for a late check out, wich is granted on availability, and costs 30$ per extra hour, or 2. Check out at the appropriate time and leave your luggage at the concierge. They would give tickets for the luggage, and once you are ready to go, they will take it to the street level. We choose the second option. We check out at 9:00 am, and leave the hotel to get the most of our time in New York.We went back to the hotel at 4:00 pm, and handed the luggage tickets to the bellboy, who gave us back our luggage. I have no complaints about the hotel or its staff, as a matter of fact, i only have compliments for this people, that make everything possible for me and my fiance to have a pleasant stay. And they achieved it

Jun 23 2009 	Very nice rooms with GREAT location and staff!	We took our two 16 year old daughters to celebrate their 16th bdays. It was a fabulous and convenient place to stay. We requested early check in and they granted it and gave us a room with a view! Nice views of time Square. I was surprised at how quiet the hotel was considering it is in the heart of Times Square. The elevators were fast and always available. The Concierge's were incredibly helpful! (and we asked them ALOT!!!) The rooms are spacious with a refridgerator and a nice flat screen tv and a safe. The bathrooms are big enough for two teenagers to get ready together. The fitness center is gorgeous (even though we didn't actually work out.) Overall, the LOCATION is just awesome...so close to everything and lots of easy little eating places without having to eat fancy. The theatres are withing a few feet of the hotel...This was just a GREAT trip and the hotel really made it that much better!

Jun 22 2009 	Marquis was fantastic!	I traveled to New York City with my kids while my wife was in Norway for memorial for her father who had passed away in March. I really didn't want to go to New York City because of the impression I had that the people were rude and shopping and restaurants were too crowded and just too much hustle and bustle to enjoy yourself. This hotel was so comfortable and inviting that we felt right at home as soon as we arrived. Check-in was fast and courteous even though there were many people also checking-in. We had a view of Time Square and the room was very clean and spacious for the three of us. All you have to do is walk outside the hotel and you are just absorbed into that wonderful lifestyle that New Yorkers are accustomed to. Everything is right there and so convenient. The restaurant right across the street (Juniors) was great. We ate there three times and every time the service was courteous and prompt. The food was the best and prices were reasonable for the middle of Manhatten. We went to several shows one of which was The Lion King which was literally 30 steps from the entrance to the hotel. It was raining when the show let out and we walked out of the theater and back into the hotel with only a few raindrops hitting us. The concierge (several different people) helped us with dinner reservations and suggestions and we could not have been happier with the choices they made. My kids and I had such a great time we are planning a return trip during Winter break. Would not think of staying anywhere else. I wa so impressed with this hotel and New York City that I'am going to try and convince my wife to move here.

Jun 22 2009 	Location location location	My family and I just returned from a week at the Marriott Marquis. We didn't use any of the hotel services (no restaurant, no fitness club), but would definitely stay here again. You just can't beat the location. We got a great rate on the Marriott website (AAA discount). They put us on the 40th floor overlooking Time Square. The plays we went to were well within walking discount (2 were less than a block). Access to subways were easy. I highly recommend Juniors Deli across the street and Times Square Bagels on 44th street for after-theatre dessert and breakfast respectively. We will definitely stay here again!

Jun 21 2009 	very very disappointing. service was awful.	I live in NYC but chose to get two rooms at this hotel for my bachelorette party. I was excited to stay in a touristy location and enjoy the amenities of the hotel like the concierge lounge. I chose this hotel in particular because my mom is a platinum Marriott Rewards member and had a lot of points that I could use. She called Marriott Reservations and explained that she wanted to book the hotel in her name, using her points, so that I would receive the amenities given to platinum members, but that they should put a note in the system saying that I was the one who would be checking in, not her. The main reason we did this was to get access to the concierge lounge, which the reservations agent said would be great and that I'd love it. I called the hotel twice during the week before my stay, double checking that it was fine for me to check in without her, etc. The people over the phone were great and said that it would be fine. When I went to check in, I was told that no note appeared in the system and that I could not check in unless I got my mother on the phone. She happened to be going out of town that day (out of the country) and I didn't think I'd be able to get her on the phone. Luckily after a few attempts I was able to reach her and she explained to the manager that I was supposed to be checking in. While all of this was happening, we were talking to the desk clerk about possible suite upgrades. She said that there were no more suites left that night, but it was okay because we were so close to the concierge lounge and we'd have a lot of space to hang out in there. After they got off the phone with my mom, the front desk clerk then informed me that (a) the concierge lounge WAS NOT OPEN OVER THE WEEKEND, and (b) it didn't matter, because I would not have been eligible for it anyway since my mom was the platinum member and not me. I'm sorry, two major problems here. The entire reason I booked this hotel was for the concierge lounge. I had ten people coming to hang out in two rooms. I wanted access to the lounge. If it was going to be closed, why did the desk agent tell me TWO SECONDS EARLIER that it didn't matter that I didn't have a suite because the lounge was so close to our room? Are you kidding me? And then to add insult to injury by saying that they wouldn't have given me access anyway? If that was really the protocol (which it may be), why wouldn't you say that while booking? Why wouldn't you say that the lounge was closed during those dates when I specifically said that I needed access to it?THEN, they screwed up the rooms. They promised that we'd have adjoining rooms with two double beds, and what do you know, they were not adjoining. I soon learned that the only adjoining rooms were king/2 doubles. We eventually just decided to move into a king room. The rooms itself were nice and fine, but I think the bottom line was that this hotel was not the best one for our needs. It really made me upset that they misrepresented it as something it was not. If we had known from the get go that the lounge was closed and that they did not have adjoining rooms that had two double beds each, we would not have booked here. Of course, we did not find out until we wasted a TON of points on our stay. I am very disappointed in what happened. I did speak to the manager about this during check in and he did not seem to care at all.

Jun 2 2009 	Girls trip to NYC	I just returned from a 3 night/4 day trip to NYC with my friends. We stayed at the Marquis for an amazing price $181.00/night unheard of for NYC. I prefer alittle quieter location. As far as the hotel goes it was top notch! We were on the 32nd floor with a tiny view of times square. The room was huge for NYC standards plenty of room for the 4 of us. There is a starbucks in the 1st floor lobby and on the 8th floor lobby. May 30 2009 	as good as they say	Most other reviewers have given the thumbs up. I must do so also. Execllent location. Modern decor. Spacious lobby. Room very large(we has a corner room). Bed clean and comfortable. Bathroom small but hey it's a bathroom. Excellent shower and towels. It can get a bit pricey, but so is all of NY. Park next door to save few bucks from valet. Coffee shop really expensive. Great deli's and coffee shops right outside front door.

May 30 2009 	Unbelieveable 36 hours in New York and this was the epicenter!	At $259 a night mid-week smack in the middle of Times Square, the Marquis is an unbelievable hotel for tourists and business visitors alike. I arrived late on a Tuesday night seriously jet-lagged. Traffic to the Marriott is blocked from Broadway, and you have to enter from 46th. Beware that even your in-car GPS system will probably not work reliably in the concrete canyons of this neighborhood.The interior is simply overwhelming with an atrium literally reaching for the sky from the 8th floor lobby. Space age, art deco, and retro designs combine to make a true 21st-century hotel lobby while capturing the richer qualities of the city's past. Check-in was absolutely painless, and I was assigned a junior suite on the 24th floor with a view of Broadway. The View rotating restaurant sits atop at the 42nd floor.The enormous 8th floor hosts a number of bars, restaurants, and the usual Starbucks and reception/concierge desks. It's easy to drift away while watching the elevators whiz overhead and sipping cappuccino or a cosmopolitan in the Atrium. Peer down upon Times Square from the Broadway Lounge, or grab some traditional sushi at Katen. I found the staff very helpful and friendly. I had breakfast in the concierge lounge on the 30th floor one day, and it was fairly standard fare. No oatmeal, however. The fitness center is comprehensive. The elevator system takes some learning but quickly becomes self-explanatory. Enter the floor you want in a keypad, and a display points you to the right lift. There's a nominal pedestrian area, and morning shows film there, so there are usually cameras about. There are plenty of photo ops with real FDNY trucks and personnel, and shopping galore within a short walk or taxi ride. Restaurants and lively spots on 46th and 47th are a few steps away. Subway access is easy, and the whole of Manhattan and Brooklyn are a few stops away.

May 26 2009 	Very convenient	In the American way, the rooms are enormous (I don't think many Americans appreciate just how humungous the average hotel room is in their country!) - two queen sized beds. Just perfect for two friends sharing. Everythign was fine - all worked well and was efficient. Loved the noodle bar restaurant. And the bar overlooking Times Square. Just the place to while away some time on a hot weekend between wearing our feet to stumps sightseeing. Perfectly placed for theatre, which we enjoyed.

May 19 2009 	Protect your valuables	After checkout I realized that I had left my expensive watch on the night table. A few hours later I contacted the hotel and was told it had not been found or turned in to lost and found. My options: none, besides reporting it to their loss prevention department. I was informed that according to NY State Statute, if a valuable is left behind, the hotel is not responsible for the loss. Guess I'll start looking for a job in hotel housekeeping; it's more lucrative than you realize and the hotel does nothing about it when sticky fingers enter the room.

May 14 2009 	location loation	The hotel certainly couldnt be better placed the tour buses just around the corner shops and theatres all nearby.We were wellcomed by smiling and efficient front desk staff, and upgraded [at a price] to a Time Square view,our room was clean and ok for size,five days in we discovered that we needed to ask for robes,seems mean considering the room rate.Despite some earlier reviews we had no problems with lifts the most we ever waited was a few minuits, guess what ever the problem was it has now been sorted.Dinner in the revolving restaurant was a pleasant enough experience but again pricey,a weak pound dosen't go very far.All in all we enjoyed our six day stay,just a gripe about NY cabs, they are the most miserable bunch I've come across in any city in the world even when you are tipping15/20% getting a smile proved impossible.

May 12 2009 	So-So	Went for Mother's day weekend with 2 daughters. Used Marriott points so for free, it was a great deal. However next time we'll stay elsewhere. The location of Times Square seemed like it'd be great but reality was we should have stayed closer to the shopping. Times Square was a nightmare to walk to/from anywhere. Obviously that's not the hotel's fault. The things I found wrong with the place were the bathroom wasn't the cleanest or in best shape(toilet seat had cracks throughout, stains on floor),had to request more towels because limited amount were kept in room, minimal toiletries are available for guests, no mini-bar or small fridge in room, NOISE from adjoining rooms and hallway was horrific--you could actually hear the toilet flushing next door, elevators were a pain to actually get on because of the fancy computerized system, temp in room was either hot or cold with no middle ground, and video checkout didn't work. Was very disappointed there wasn't a salon in the hotel.

May 8 2009 	AMAZING Location!!!!!	Rooms: Very clean, room service is great, very spacious, great flat screen TVs, unfortunately the coffee machine is very poor. Otherwise great. Service: Was a bit worried about reviews saying lines were long or they had to wait an hour for the lfits, but we had no such issues!!!Internet: Very expensive 16.95 per 24 hours, but it works well?!Things I would change about the hotel: Add a swimming pool to the gym! Have a kettle in the room, have different toiletries! (ginger smelling was not very nice!)Stayed here for over 7 nights, overall very happy!

May 7 2009	Great Location	You don't stay at the Marriott Marquis for price...it is just the place to be. I usually prefer values, but am addicted to the convenience that the NYC Marquis offers. If you are travelling to NYC for theater, shopping, and Times Square, there is no better place to stay. Yes, the rooms needs to be updated, staff could be friendlier, and prices could be lower. May 6 2009 	Brillant location	First visit and certainly not the last. Great location, smack bang in Time Square. Good hotel very busy, no problems with Lifts. Service was good, we wanted a late checkout and we were offered until 3.00pm and no extra cost.

Apr 21 2009	Perfect for First Time NYC Visitors	I booked this room for free with my Marriott rewards points, so I can't really complain about anything. This is a standard Marriott room (spacious and clean) in the heart of Times Square. Apr 20 2009 	Right on Times Square... but	Having stayed in The Times Square area before, we knew of The Marquis and decided to give it a go this time as it is right in Times Square. Apr 18 2009 	Excellent place for first girls trip to NYC!	Quiet, clean room, excellent location.....walking distance to lots of attractions & food. Staff were very courteous. Apr 13 2009 	Great hotel right in the middle of the action	I've stayed here before, and whilst I'm still a Gold Elite I thought I'd stay here again, as the status means I'd probably get upgraded, and also lounge access - handy for the free internet as I don't like paying for net access if I can avoid it. It does form part of my decision of where to stay nowadays, and it's time some of the large chains realised that fleecing their customers is not right, though I can understand why they do it as the business travellers expense it so they can charge the high rates.Got a room on the concierge floor (30th), and no complaints with the room. Very comfortable bed as always, and blackout curtains so you can sleep at any time of the day or night - handy for those bright Times Square lights! No noise issues from the street either.Had a few issues with the lift this time, which has never happened before. They do tend to get very crowded at peak times (E.g. 7.30pm when people head for the theatres) so leave a bit earlier, and you'll be fine.I'll be staying here again if I get a good rate. If you want to be in the middle of the action, nearby the theatres and don't mind a large impersonal hotel then this is the place to be.
Apr 11 2009 	Great Stay right on Times Square	If you are looking for a Marriot on Times Square this is the place to go! Great Service, Concierge Lounge, Amazing...2 words STAY HERE!

Apr 10 2009 	Treated like cattle	This hotel has an excellent location on Times Square but is horribly blighted by the lift( elevator) service.There are 2000 rooms and a huge conference facility, but the elevators are simply not adequate to service them. We had a room on the 43rd floor - with great views of Times Square, but it took up to 30 minutes for a lift to arrive to take us up to the room and the same to bring us down. We lost a dinner reservation and nearly lost our theatre evening as a result. When the conference attendees who use the conference centre in the bottom 7 floors of the hotel come out of their conferences the lift system is totally overwhelmed and basically closes down. The problem is that the elevators would probably be adequate to service just the rooms, but once 2-3000 conference delegates are added the system closes down, and starts to malfunction ( lifts fail to arrive, or come, but the doorsdo not open, or the outer door does open, but the inner door does not, which makes passengers very nervous). The staff ( with the exception of the woman who mans the front desk for the 48th floor View restaurant) were mainly sympathetic, but quite frank about their total inability to help. Eventually one evening I had the duty manager accompany us to our floor in the freight elevator after we had waited ( tired,hungry and needing the bathroom after a day out in the city) nearly 40 minutes for an elevator up to our floor.At nearly $700 dollars per room per night, I naively assumed that actually being able to get up to and down from the room would be included, but not so. The most they could dowas advise us not to try to use the elevators when the conference delgates were likely to be doing so, but frankly, being effectively trapped either in my room or 43 floors below is not my idea of customer service. My complaints led to nothing - no reduction in room rate, not so much as the offer of a cup of coffee whilst the elevators setlled down.This is a greedy hotel, which sells a far greater capacity than the infrastructure can cope with. Avoid it. There are plenty of hotels in the area that respect their customers and do not treat then as an inconvenience.

Apr 8 2009 	They Could Care Less	We had a number of problems: they ran out of rooms, they had no rooms with double beds, they did not want to honor the "breakfast included" clause. The single biggest issue was the front desk staff, especially the front desk managers (who were worse than the main desk employees). Since they were full, they reasoned, our experience meant nothing. They did not apologize, they were not accomodating. It was infuriating. The rooms are ok, the location good, the value poor, the elevators horrible (this is a bigger deal than you realize if you want to come and go at dinner time). I have stayed at several other Times Square Hotels (W, Westin, Michelangelo, etc.) - all are MUCH better. AVOID the Marquis.

Apr 5 2009 	Great hotel. Few issues probably won't bug you	I've stayed for a long time at this hotel. I've been there in 2004 for around three weeks, and stayed again in 2007 for roughly the same time.The location is probably the best in NYC. Right on Times Square, and if you like to walk like myself you can probably reach any Manhattan point by foot, which is a pretty nice way to see the city inmy opinion.Rooms were also very good. I took a few classes in NY and everytime I got back to the hotel I felt really comfortable. You have al that nice common stuff like pay per view movies, cable, safe, nice shower, and even a coffee maker. It is very spacious and some views are great.The Internet service is very fast, and easy to use. I used it with cables, so I can't comment on the wi-fi. Great bed, good workdesk, and overall a very spacious room, especially for NYC. My room was way bigger than in the other Marriott I stayed in the city once. The name escapes me now (sorry everybody) but it is a very nice hotel close to Times Square too. The gym seems like something from the future. There are flat screen Tvs so you can walk while listening to TV. You have a view of Times Square from there, and lots of equipment. Some were a little unusual to me since I'm more used to just lifting free weights, but it was a nice experience, and 24/7 if I recall correctly.Cleanliness was OK. My first service complain is actually about the housekeeping services. I've spend a lot of time studying and I didn't make much of a mess in the room, so I was fine with having a lot of timw without housekeeping and the privacy to let my things wherever I wanted them with not much concern. They would call me because they have some policy of having to clean rooms from time to time. It makes some sense (they can check that I'm no terrorist or suicidal guy I guess), but it was bothersome and, when they came, the cleaning wasn't really great. They behind left a bunch of empty soda battles that I had "stored" on the airmoire (is that the right word?) besides the TV since the trash can was small.The Internet was great as I said, except when it failed. If had a connection problem, and I had to make several calls to some center oustide of the hotel (probably outside of US) and then get a guy to fix it, which didn't work. They ended up changing my room after a lot of trouble. At least they gave me a better view, so that was cool.The room service is nice if you're not standing there for much time, or if you sleep at night (it works only until 2 am or something). Not many health options though. My main complain is that they got it wrong more than once. I would ask for a egg white omelet and I'd get a very yellow omelet that was definitely not make of egg whites. The people who delivered the food were all extremely nice. One even managed to remember me from a single brief talk in 2007 (I was istening to a Brazil-Argentina soccer game n the radio and he remembered it). Outstanding!The breakfast in the hotel restaurant (there's ony one for breakfast) may be the best I've ever had. Friendly staff, and if you choose the buffet you'd had lots of variety with any kind of eggs or pancakes, oatmeal, some kinds of fruit, cereal, bagels, and as much oragne juice and coffee as you want. Loved it.The gift shop was very resourceful and, even if you don't want to buy anything from it, you're right at Times Square, so it's hard to feel helpless for anything. It's hard to find a conventional supermarket I guess, but that's a Manhattan thing. The gift shop attendants were also very nice.There are two Starbucks IN the building. One at the lobby (8th floor) and the more assorted one is more shared with outsiders at ground level.I haven't had drinks, sushi and what not, but the lobby has a nice Times Square view and a few eating options.It isn't hard to order pizzas, sandwiches or any kind of meal from the hotel, but you have to go down to the ground level to meet the delivery guy there. I really didn't mind, so that was OK to me.I guess I can also say that NY is NOT the city that never sleeps. I'm from Sao Paulo in Brazil and I feel that Sao Paulo gives me more options at night. If you want to eat really late at night, you're out of luck, unless you want to wander the streets looking for some place. That won't affect any people though.There is also no minibar, so my advice is to ask for a fridge. They will provide a small fridge in the room for 25 bucks (you payjust once for the whole stay) , and it was enough for me to keep plenty of sodas and yogurt.That's about what I can tell you. I emphasized some issues, but I had just a few in like 6 weeks during my 2 stays there. So, overall, you'll probaby be very happy with this hotel. Works for business, leisure, study, whatever you need. PS: They also were able to deliver to me stuff that I bought on-line, even when the arrival was before my check in date (I noticed them, of course).

Mar 31 2009 	Great Location for NYC Theater Times Square Views Dramatic Lobby.	Spent two nights with friends to see a Broadway show, a hockey game at the Garden, and enjoy the tourist heart of Manhattan. This hotel is perfectly situated for all of these activities. Great views of Times Square are possible, even if you don't pay extra for them (we didn't and still had an excellent vista). Plus, the hotel is new-ish which means its standard rooms are decently sized by Manhattan's broom closet standards. The lobby atrium soars 40 stories which puts some additional pzazz into things, and the hotel was clean and everything ran efficiently. Although there were lots of tourists and business people in the hotel, I never heard a peep once my door closed and never had too long a wait for an elevator. Registration took only a minute, the restaurant and bar staff people were courteous, prompt and efficient, and I was able to checkout at a kiosk, which took less than a minute to accomplish. My only gripe was with our housekeeper, who accosted us in a nearly impenetrable West Indian accent to complain about wet sheets. It seems one member of our party had sweated as he slept (before we reduced the room temperature). Aside from being rude, the housekeeper should have acted like a professional, kept her mouth shut and simply done her job. Instead, she preferred to embarass us. After her complaint I immediately checked the sheets and mattress thoroughly and found no hint of dampness whatsoever, except for a touch of it along the top of one sheet. I suspect this housekeeper's real problem was sociological, but in any event her issue did not ruin our visit. But unlike all the other staff members I dealt with, housekeeping received no gratuity from me, although I hope this description here serves as an appropriate "tip."Helpful info: The lobby and registration desk are located on the 8th Floor. You will not find any signs telling you this. If you've never stayed at this hotel, you'll waste time wandering around its rather disorganized, chopped up ground floor trying to figure out how to enter. The hotel entrance is located halfway down 44th or 45th Street, not on Broadway, but you'd never know this until you've stumbled across it once or twice.Elevators are unusual in that you punch your desired floor onto a control board at the front of the elevator bank, which then assigns you to an elevator (they're lettered, if the control board tells you "N," for instance, you go stand in front of the elevator marked "N"). There are no elevator buttons inside the elevator itself.

Mar 31 2009 	Great Hotel Great Location	All right, I am a bit prejudiced here. First time I have been here for a while, but it has always been one of my favorite hotels and certainly my preferred hotel and location in New York. Intimate and cosy it is not - this is a big international hotel set up to deal with the masses and the hustle and bustle of Times Square is either to your liking or not.I have always liked the atrium which goes up 30 floors or so from reception. The lifts only take a few seconds for the trip and the glass bubble ones are better than most fairground rides but not, I suspect, if you suffer from vertigo. When I used to come you could wait half an hour for a lift, but they seem to have sorted that out with a new computerised routing system. The galleries around each floor used to be open, but have rather been spoiled by the addition of metal guards - this was apparently necessary after three people jumped in the space of 20 months which must have upset the diners at the bottom somewhat.There is a revolving restaurant up top which is great for Sunday brunch. Apart from that there is no shortage of venues to eat and drink in both inside and out of the hotel. The rooms are spacious and comfortable, with large safes. No robe, slippers or mini bar though which seems odd. $16.95 a day for the internet is over the top.Not a cheap hotel, but if you can get a deal I would recommend the experience.

Mar 29 2009 	Fantastic hotel Fantastic location - look forward to returning!!	This hotel was excellent and centrally situated in Times Square in the hussle and bustle, we requested a room on a high floor and was given a room on the 39th Floor - which was perfect as there wasn't any traffic noise. We went with my17 yr old daughter and the room which overlooked Times Square was of good size with 2 double beds which had memory foam mattresses, ideal for a relaxing nights sleep after a busy day of sightseeing!! I had read in previous reviews negative comments on the reception area being busy etc., .....well yes it was busy but this is a massive hotel and to us just added to the atmosphere, staff were never tool busy to be helpful :) We didn't eat at the hotel as we wanted to experience the "real" New York which was fab, there are plenty of "Diners" all within close proximity of the hotel. worthy of note is that the price shown on the menu will undoubtly when you get to the till be plus tax......something we found annoying, but will remember for next time! They do also expect tips and one waiter even called out after us that service was not included and were we leaving him something, we took this in good humour but can be very heavily focused on "tipping" . We did endulge ourselves at the hotel, by going up to the 48th Floor to "The View" which is has a revolving restaurant/bar which offers stunning views over New York.....We went in the evening when the city is all lit up, It is expensive to drink/eat here, but it is worth it to take in the breathtaking scenery, so DO allow $30 dollars for this experience (2 cokes and one cocktail) :) We could not fault the hotel or the staff. At all times whilst walking around Times Square (and the rest of New York) at night with my daughter we never felt intimidated or nervous...... We did all the usual touristy things.......Including Empire State Building, Statue of Liberty Island visit - did you know that if you can't afford do the Statute of Liberty Crusie/trip to the island you can catch the Statton Island ferry for free, this offers good views of the Statue of Liberty and Island, so for those on a budget do this :) We did not go for the shopping although we did buy a few clothes, it wasn't that cheap as the  & $ was not too different when we went,. We flew with Virgin Airways from Heathrow and it was on time both ways and the food/onboard entertainment was excellent - I would definately recommend and use Virgin and visit the Hotel Marquis again. We choose to go from JFK Airport to the hotel by yellow cab, this cost us $50 each way. If you want a holiday/break that will offer an excellent location and clean comfortable rooms......you will not go wrong with the Marriott Marquis we would definately stay here again - please feel free to ask any questions should you wish.

Mar 26 2009 	Best hotel in Times Square	This hotel is the best-located hotel in Times Square. Many rooms are available that overlook Times Square and they are up to the usual modern Marriott room standards. We stayed here for a weekend with the kids and they loved the view of Times Square. Upon exiting the hotel, you are in the middle of Times Square and the theater district, unlike some hotels which claim "Times Square" locations but are actually a block or two away. The check-in process was quick, although a large hotel like this could probably see check-in overwhelmed by a large surge on other days. Our room was clean and in generally good shape. The beds were comfortable and the furniture and decor were standard "modern Marriott." The weekend rate for a hotel in this location was reasonable for New York, but by no means a bargain. If you value location over price, it is worth paying a little more to be here. This is a large hotel and one should not expect personalized service, but we found the staff to friendly and courteous. Also, we got a very quick response to a request for a toothbrush kit when we realized we'd forgotten our son's. This hotel also has a great excercise room which overlooks Times Square and two Starbucks cafes for those who need their lattes. They also have parking, but be prepared to pay Motel 6 room rates just to store your vehicle.The hotel restaurants looked tempting, but frankly, with all the restaurants in Manhattan, I'd look elsewhere for food. Our favorites included Kang Suh for Korean barbecue and the nearby John's Pizza if you want some simple lunch fare for the family.

Mar 9 2009 	Amazing Marriott Marquis	I stayed in the Marriott Marquis with a friend for 5 nights in February and it was brilliant! The lift system is brilliant and makes alot of sense and we were never waiting more than 2 or 3 minutes for a lift. Check in was swift, although the guy at the desk wasn't listening to a word I said and despite telling him that we were paying cash, he swiped my card and then didn't tell me he was putting an authorisation of 185 on it incase of any charges incurred because you pay on arrival. Apart from that, it was fine and we were given our keys and room number. Our room was HUGE! It was a normal guest room with a view of the river. I was devestated checking out, I would kill for a bed like that at home and it was so spacious!! The rooms were cleaned everyday and towels were changed whenever we needed them. The only downside was no minibar or refridgerator but we just kept the ice bucket filled and it was fine! Breakfast was included on three mornings of our package and it was so tasty. Feb 3 2009 	Honeymoon in NYC	A wonderful 6 night stay at The Marriott Marquis. A fantastic location - you walk out onto Times Square! Great sized rooms with awesome views of either times square or the hudson river. The most comfortable beds we have EVER slept in! Great concierge staff for such a large hotel and every type of eaterie you could think of (starbucks, bars, restaurantsm lounges and shops). TIP: definitely try the dessert buffet at The View Lounge - the view from the window seats in this revolving bar/restaurant is amazing and well worth the 15 per head with as many desserts as you can eat.We never had a problem with lifts, you sometimes have to wait a minute or so for one to come along but even on new year's eve we were never frustrated by this as the 'in the heart of it' location more than makes up for any wait at the lift shaft!!The only down that we can possibly think of if we are being really picky is that we only got one breakfast teabag per day - but when we asked for some, half a bag full was bought up to our room - they obviously didnt realise the importance of a good cup of tea on a freezing cold January morning!

Feb 3 2009	Great Hotel	This is a great hotel and the location is fantastic.The staff in the hotel were so friendly. There's a choice of restaurants in the hotel. Will definitely be staying here again and would highly recommend it.

Jan 30 2009	Fantastic Location	Really enjoyed my stay in this hotel. My family and I, two young children, loved this hotel. But there is something to be said for walking out of your hotel into the middle of Times Square, avoiding taxis and driving and having everything within a few blocks. Overall a great experience and hotel.

Jan 26 2009 	This is my new NYC favorite hotel	I travel to NYC quite often and have stayed at quite a few hotels...the Marriott Marquis is now my favorite...its located right in Times Square, which is central to all the NYC nightlife. The rooms are spacious and clean, the hotel is well kept and it has the best concierge floor ...a great place to wind down after business meetings and the breakfast is the best! All the Broadway theatres are within walking distance and I've never had a bad meal in any of the wonderful 8th street restaurants...the waitstaff is used to diners who must watch the time in order to catch a show. This is my new NYC "home away from home!".

Jan 23 2009 	Christmas Lights in New York	This visit was our first to New York. My wife and I were there to see the sights and the Christmas lights. We arrived early, 9:30 am, and were pleasantly surprised that our room was ready. The room was a good size and nicely decorated. The room was quiet and the bed was very comfortable. The best feature of the Marquis is the location. It is right in the middle of the action. It is an easy walk to the Rockerfeller Center, Radio City Music Hall, Carnegie Hall, Museum of Modern Art, and all of the theaters. When we checked out, we put our bags in storage and did some sight seeing before catching a late flight. When it was time to go, the bellboys quickly retrieved our bags and got us a cab to the airport.In other reviews I saw complaints about the wait time for elevators. We thought that elevator system was excellent. You press the button for your floor and the control assigns you an elevator. For the first 3 days of our stay the the elevator was there almost immediately. Our last day was Saturday and the hotel seemed to be busier. You could wait 2-3 minutes for an elevator. The only complaint that we had was the billing. We booked the room in September and the charges went on the credit card immediately. The charge was over $70 more than the cost of the stay. It seemed bad enough to charge for the rooms in advance without adding other charges.The Marquis is expensive but it is a great place to stay on Broadway.

Jan 21 2009 	Fantastic stay at well organized hotel	However already some time ago (april/may 2008), we still have truly good memories of this mega-sized hotel right in the heart of broadway/46th. On the day of arrival weather conditions were poor and we therefore opted for the choice of our room on a rather low level (12th floor, but facing TSQ, what a surpise) instead of the 40th overlooking the river. We couldnot have chosen better and had wonderful sights (day en nighttime obviously). We experienced all over helpful staff, friendly assistance at all times and can recommend this efficient hotel to anybody visiting the big apple although cleaning is below expectation (hair and pieces of torn paper). An absolute must- and this is an understatement - is "'The View" rotating restaurant at the almost top floor with absolutely spectacular views, swift and friendly service during the buffet (lovely, wide range an absolutely top quality all the way!!!!!!), it made us come back 2 times more! We were overwhelmed and for sure impressed which is why we won't stop visiting this brilliant, vibrating, surprising city that never sleeps..... It must be said that in this part of Manhattan we felt a lot safer at many times instead of in various Dutch cities i.e. Amsterdam, Rotterdam, Utrecht. Need we say more? Go go, go!!! Have fun and have the time of your life!!!!!

Jan 11 2009	Marriott Marquis could used better security.	Stayed there last night after seeing Billy Elliott. We had a large, clean room with 2 double beds on the 32d floor. It was almost midnight. When we left our room at around 11:45 pm, there was a garishly dressed young woman standing by a door a few rooms away from our room, talking on her cell phone. As we left, she knocked on a door and did not get an answer, which made her agitated as she continued to speak on the phone. As we walked past her, my companion looked back. The apparent escort then screamed a slew of profanities towards us. Later we decided to call a hotel manager; we were concerned that our personal security was compromised. My companion called the front desk when we returned. There was no manager available to talk to her. She noted the lack of security, the inappropriateness of the hotel allowing obvious prostitutes to knock on doors at the hotel. The operator did not apologize or call a manager but promised to follow up on the matter. Nobody ever contacted us. We are not prudish and could care less if someone hires a hooker for his room as long as it is handled discreetly. Jan 8 2009 	Bed Bugs!	Our stay at this hotel was unfortunately ruined by the bed bug infestation in our room! As soon as we left the hotel the bites ceased. Jan 6 2009 	Perfect Location!	This hotel was fantastic. I was a little concerned by some of the other reviews before booking, considering we were using a very large amount of points to stay for New Year's. We arrived on Tues. Dec. 30, to wonderful and quick check in, and an upgraded room that overlooked Times Square that we requested upon booking. We were not disappointed. Yes, the hotel is quite large, and the lift system could be intimidating, but actually very easy. This was most likely the busiest time being New Year's and we had no trouble whatsoever with waiting for elevators. Even after the ball dropped it only took 15-20 min. to get back into our room. The hotel itself is in the best location. It is within walking distance to everything, and we walked, and walked, and walked until we saw it all. I would not recommend taking kids on a New York City trip, but if you did, you would find plenty for them to do near this hotel. The giant Toysrus across the street alone would provide hours of entertainment with the giant ferris wheel and walk in barbie house. You can be at Rockefeller center in minutes and we even braved the Subway which was way easier than I ever anticipated. Overall the location could not be beat, and the service was excellent. We were comped free breakfast in the hotel restaurant every morning ($70 every day) and the staff were above and beyond helpful with directions, mapping out every detail for us to get from point a to b, and making reservations at whatever our request was. The hotel was very clean, and housekeeping was great adhering to our schedule each day. Had a great and exhausting time trying to see it all. Thank goodness our home base was Times Square. Oh and the best part is you are directly across from ABC studio where they tape Good Morning America, so you can get up and walk across the street and see yourself on TV. Too funny. Enjoy!

Jan 5 2009 	Great hotel in the heart of it all!	We stayed at the Marriott from Jan 2-3, 2009. This was a perfect hotel for us. It was our first visit to New York, so we wanted to stay central and near everything. This hotel was perfect for us. When we arrived, they upgraded us to a Times Square view with no extra charge! Fabulous. We had a king sized bed that was VERY comfortable. We were on the 27th floor. They wished my husband a happy birthday on check in since I mentioned it in the comments when booking. It was a nice touch. We also purchased a $40 birthday surprise. I added a picture of what this included. We loved the elevators and had absolutely no wait problems with them. All the staff was courteous and helpful to find our way around New York. The subway entrance is very close and convenient. Shopping and Broadway theatres are right outside the doors. The view lounge is perfect for people watching Times Square while keeping warm. Everything to us looked newly remodeled. When we closed our curtains, we had no problem with the lights from Times Square. We couldn't hear any noise unless a vehicle with a siren went near our hotel. I will stay here again when visiting New York! Easy to get a cab when leaving.

Jan 2 2009 	A Big Apple Letdown	As a platinum Marriott card holder I expected this hotel and service to be great. It wasn't. Dec 29 2008 	Great location but that's about it...	As others have noted, this hotel is in the center of the center in New York City. Located at 7th Avenue and 45th street, you can't get much more convenient to Times Square. However, the MAJOR drawback to this hotel is the elevator system. Granted, with 1,892 rooms in a hotel which encompasses an entire city block, moving people around the hotel is a challenge, to be sure. My wife and I routinely waited 10+ minutes for an elevator at peak times, and close to the same amount of time at all other times. Guests enter their destination floor on a keypad, whose computer system then directs the guest to a particular elevator. In theory, I suppose this is used to consolidate trips, and therefore expedite travel, but in our experience it doesn't seem to work all that effectively. Based on the extreme challenge of easily getting to and from our room in this system, coupled with the fact that street level is 8 floors below the check-in/restaurant/shops level, my wife and I will find another Marriott property in the city to stay at the next time we visit. Even the 1st rate location is not enough to overcome the poor internal transit system, in our opinion.

Dec 24 2008 	Brilliant!!!	Loved everything about this hotel. Fantastic location right in the heart of Times Square. Dec 21 2008 	Location - great. Staff attitude - disappointing.	We stayed for 4 nights at the Marriott Marquis Times Square for 4 nights in Dec 08 for a few days away for my grilfriend's birthday. The hotel is ideally located right in the heart of times square - and you really feel like you are at the centre of the earth staying here. It was especially good for us as we were only staying in NYC for a few days and did not have a great deal of time to be finding our bearings. With so much to see and do in NYC it was really good to be at the heart of it.The hotel is very impressive, a typically giant US hotel. However, the staff were very impersonal and on several occasions disappointed us. On reception they could be quite blunt if they were busy doing something and you approached them. We had a problem on check in whereby they actually checked us into a room where there were already some other people's bags in the room! We went straight back downstairs and the lady corrected the checkin and put us in another room, although the view was out the back of the hotel and not looking onto times square as the previous one had been. I pointed out to the lady that having seen the previous room we would like to see if she could find us one with a similar view, and she did. However, the next day we found that our new room had a leak in the bathroom ceiling caused by the torrential rain. We asked maintenance to come and take a look and left them sorting it out as we headed out for the afternoon. I asked them to update reception as to whether we would need to move rooms. Upon our return I asked the guy on reception what the outcome was and he quite abruptly just responded ' ID please' to look up our room details. Then without any conversation or explanation he simply started tapping away on screen and handed us some new entry cards for a new room - no explanation or apology offered, seemingly unaware that this would represent an inconvenience to us. As he had said practically nothing throughout the exchange I made a point of asking 'So we'll need to change rooms then?', but he did not take this opportunity to apologise and simply said yes. So i then said, 'so we'll need to move all our stuff then?' at which point he realised we weren't happy and offered to send some assistance. I told him not to bother himself and walked off.Overall I would say the location is excellent and the rooms generally pretty nice, and from what I gather a good size for NYC. For this reason, I would probably recommend the Marriott Marquis. Dec 11 2008 	pick-up the discarded room service carts and trash	I have stayed at the Marriott a number of times and for the first time I have been dissatisfied. Dec 8 2008 	Great Place	We stayed at this hotel for one night in summer 2008 and I have to say that it was interesting. Very busy place!!! We arrived by car. Dec 7 2008 	Not what I expected	The view was GREAT! The room lacked.... One of the tiles in tiles in the bathroom shower was broken and the room just looked old. I expected more for $600 a night, but I guess I paid for location and the view!

Dec 7 2008 	Center of it all	The Marriott Marquis is an attraction within itself in the middle of Times Square in Manhattan. I've stayed at a lot of hotels in the past, and the lobby being on the 8th floor is a small hassle, since the elevators take forever to arrive to the lobby, and the escalators even longer. The staff is very friendly, and there are employees everywhere that are willing to help.My friends and I visit NYC frequently and love trying new hotels in the area, on all different scales. For this big box hotel, we were quite satisfied by the rate we paid, the service we received, and the location at the center of it all. Dec 2 2008	Overcharging - Billing Hassles	I was a guest at a private event just before Thanksgiving week, and the banqueting team incorrectly charged my credit card $400 for another table's wine. Although they assured me the charge would be corrected and wouldn't appear on my credit card, indeed I was charged for it. I have spent the past two weeks lost in the quagmire of their service center, accounting and in-house events department - to no avail. I am STILL stuck with a false $400 charge on my credit card. But this mistake, their inability to correct it, and the labrynth of automated phone conversations ("Press 1 to be connected to...") and well-meaning but ill-equipped off-site service centers is simply unacceptable.

Nov 30 2008 	An Overly Priced Bar With Unfriendly and Rushed Service	I am writing my review based on my experience of the Broadway Lounge at the hotel lobby:We sat down with a nice table overlooking Times Square. We wanted to order some coffee (I wanted to go for a Martini but it was too early for one) and something quick to eat. The ambiance of the hotel lobby and bar is very nice, clean, airy and I was very impressed with how nice everything look... but that's just the only good thing that this place has.After waiting for over 15 minutes and seeing one waiter running back and forth all over the place, I thought we had to order at the bar. As I started walking that way, the very rushed, unfriendly and sweaty waiter took our order and left. We ordered to cafe lattes and an order of the chicken quesadilla.About 10 minutes later, we got our lattes and about 5 minutes later the quesadilla. I do have to say, the food was pretty good as well as the lattes. Mind you that the whole time we sat there with our coffees and empty water glasses, no one came over to check on us. Meanwhile, I did see a few servers standing by the bar area chatting away and even one of the managers walking around the restaurant but not really doing anything... hum...All of the sudden a crazy man that we saw earlier on the street singing to himself, found his way to the bar and now he is at the piano, playing it rather badly. Another one of the very unfriendly servers was talking to a patron and I asked her to come over and she yelled from 2 tables away: "I will send you your server!" I told her to come over and explained what it was. She left. A few minutes later, a security person removed the man from the piano but not escorted out. My friend actually ran into him in the bathroom (after the piano fiasco) talking to himself and screaming profanities.We left the bar but I am rather disappointed that the personnel here is so rushed, unfriendly, not following through with customers needs and just with a "I don't care" attitude. I have received better service at lower class places and if I am paying $30 for 2 coffees and a quesadilla, I do expect to receive service from someone who cares.

Nov 28 2008	The Best Customer Service!!	We stayed here again for the 3rd or 4th time and once again it was amazing! I love this hotel!!! We travelled all night and arrived in the city at about 8:30am. We wanted to just check our bags with the bellman knowing that we would check in several hours later. But the man at the front desk let us check in at 9am!!!! We couldnt believe it. He was so nice and it was incredibly appreciated since we were exhausted. I love this hotel and recommend it to everyone!

Nov 26 2008 	Sweet Hotel	Now being an employee of Marroitt Hotels in the UK we did recieve an employment discount, none the less the overall experiance @ the Marquis was fantastic.We had a room on the 37th floor (room 3721 iirc) which had to of been one of the best views of time square!!Before we booked this hotel we did read mixed reviews (majority of which told you not to stay here) however we took the gamble and had an awesome time and I thoroughly recommend it.You can not check in until 4pm each day. We stayed here from the 23rd to the 25th of Nov 2008 (3 22yr old friends in one room with 2 double/queen beds). There was a Q for check-in which took all of a few moments to clear and we then checked in with no hassle and was told what a fantastic view we had (he was not lying), left our bags with conciege (however you spell it) and went out into times square for a few hours.After arriving back around 5/6ish we collected our keys (no problems no qing) and went straight to our room and our bags were bought to our rooms within 20 minutes.Clean, comfortable, nice decor, excellant view, hassle free (no qing for lifts etc). We had a very spacious room, 42" plasma, ipod player/alarm clock, ensuite, wardrobe, safe, hairdryer and a bog which was all very pleasent.This hotel can be very very very very busy espeically below floor 8 where check in is situated and qing for lifts on the round floor can take a long time (just take the escalators and get a lift from another floor if you want to).The cost of eating and drinking in the hotel is expensive and personally i think a normal person paying in excess of $500 a night here is ludacris but you are paying for the location fact!! We ate here once which was our last night after a weeks break which was at the 'VIEW RESTAURANT/BAR' which is the revolving bar @ the top of the hotel. The views are stunning and you have prices reflecting it a bottle of corona extra was $9 each (all be it we did have a few) and we also had the buffet which they do each night in the bar area which was $30 and very poor/basic e.g salads. Again you pay for the view.I could talk for ages about this hotel but i won't. Overall very good experaince and i suggest a high floor because there is a bit of noise the lower you are but the views are worth it.

Nov 26 2008 	Great New York Location	This hotel, to me, was excellent! It was right in Time Square in the center of all the Broadway action. We really didn't have anything major planned for the weekend, so it was nice to be close so we didn't have far to look. It was an incredible busy hotel and lobby, but I didn't have to wait long to check in or for the elevators. Being so close to Thanksgiving I was worried about the crowds, but it wasn't bad. Our room was on the 43rd floor and the view was amazing, especially at night. The room was a nice size, especially for NYC, and it was warm and cozy on the freezing evenings to look out and watch the city. I would definitely stay here again when visiting the city!

Nov 25 2008 	Big Disappointment - I'll never stay at a Marriott again!	My fiancee and I stayed here for a fun getaway but were so disappointed by mistakes made by staff at check-in, condition of the room, and customer service in general that it nearly ruined our weekend. We scheduled a 1PM check-in, arrived at 1:30 and found that the room would not be ready until 4 - regular check-in time! We settled our bill, left our bags and returned at 4:45 when we were supposed to be able to "simply" pick up our keys - only to find that the room was still not ready. Stephanie, at the desk, switched our room to another, but failed to mention that it had two double beds (later referred to as Queen-sized by staff, but I have a Queen at home and this is much smaller), not the King we had originally reserved - we would only find this out after waiting 45 additional minutes to get into the room! It took 20 minutes to get onto an elevator alone, and when we got there a housekeeping cart was blocking the entrance. The houskeeper told us it would be at least another 15-20 minutes, so I called the desk to ask how they could give us a room that's not ready? I spoke with Ralph, who said he would call the housekeeper to find out what the problem was. But honestly, how can you blame her? The desk should know when a room is ready for guests! To get another room would have taken too long, according to Ralph, so we waited in the hall, realizing that at this point we would have to cancel our dinner reservations and go straight to our 8PM show. When we did get into the room, that's when we realized it was not a King bed. Another futile call to the desk but there was nothing else available - the hotel was overbooked, actually. To compensate, the best they could offer was a free breakfast (which I didn't want, because we had a special place already picked out), and a call from the concierge to make new (after show) dinner reservations. The concierge, Zoe, did call me shortly thereafter to help make new reservations, (couldn't get into the other place at 10) but said she would check with the new restaurant and call me back. We waited in the room for 1/2 an hour but never recieved a call. We did get to enjoy the view at this point, complete with a dirty butt print in the center of our window!!!! Downstairs, after getting ready and never getting a call back, I went to the concierge desk and found that Zoe was on a break. Thankfully, Alejandra was able to quickly set us up with new reservations. After the show, Chez Josephine's, recommended by the hotel, was mediocre French food at best. The risotto was cruncy, the hangar steak was 3 slices of meat... I get better food at a diner in South Jersey - and for much less than $150/couple (that's with just 1 drink, not a bottle, by the way!) Back at the hotel we were finally able to get 2 free drinks at the rotating bar on the top floor for our troubles. Later, in our room the thin walls allowed us to enjoy the couple next door arguing from 3 to 5 AM. Also, with almost zero water pressure in the shower and a toilet that eats and spits back toiletpaper, rather than flushing it, it's a good thing we used up all our Marriott Rewards points (plus paid $200), because we'll never stay at another Marriott again. The last few times there was always an issue of some kind, and I'm tired of taking my chances.My advice: stay at the W if you want to be in the heart of the city, or go to the Rivington downtown for the same price and an absolutely exquisite room.

Nov 14 2008 	Thoroughly Enjoyable	We returned this week from a wonderful stay in NYC at the Marriott Marquis. We received a reasonable (for NYC) rate from the hotel website. Upon checking in, I mentioned that we were celebrating my daughter's 21st birthday . We were assigned a room with a fantastic view over Duffy Square. The entire hotel appeared to have been recently renovated. The hotel staff provided excellent, friendly service. The new elevator system worked like a charm. We never waited more than a few seconds at the designated elevator.All in all, the hotel contributed to a magical visit to NYC that our daughter will always remember.

Nov 13 2008 	Super expensive but good quality and service	I attended a conference at the Marriott Marquis and decided to stay there for the sake of convenience. It is extremely expensive, but understandable due to the location: right on Times Square.The room was clean and comfortable; we even had a side view of Times Square. The conference facilities and lunch provided was excellent.I definitely recommend this hotel if you want to be in the middle of it all.

Nov 7 2008 	Distinctly average but good location	We have just returned from spending 5 nights at the Marriott Marquis. The good thing about this hotel is the location in Time Square, which is a good central location to get around the sights. But the location alone does not warrant the $550 -$650 a night. The problem with this hotel is varied, namely the size of the hotel causes problems and long wait at the lifts. Having "The View" restaurant and Bar on the top of the hotel seems to draw coach loads of people to the lifts especially in the evenings, which gets like a rugby scrum and can take 10 minutes to get to your room from the ground floor. The concierge desk seemed to be having a personal challenge between them to get rid of customers as quickly as possible, No personal touch at all. The rooms are a good size, particularly for New York, but no Mini Bar and the glasses we used on the 1st night in the room were never replaced for the other 4 days we stayed. My recommendation would be don't bother and get some decent food for 1/2 the price!In summary as a Marriott rewards gold holder I have stayed in lots of Marriott Hotels around America and in Europe and this is the worst one. Nov 4 2008 	Great Location	This hotel is right in the middle of Times Square and right in the middle of ALL the action. The hotel is MASSIVE and can be overwhelming, but the staff is very friendly and helpful. The elevator system is very functional. The rooms were very nice. It is expensive, but it IS New York and it is in the middle of everything!

Nov 2 2008	Wonderful hotel in the heart of New York	The Marriott Marquis is located in the heart of Times Square and is at the high end of Marriott's chain of accommodations and appointments. It is easily reached by subway or taxi, and entered through a breezeway beneath the hotel. Elevators lead up to the 8th floor where the main lobby is located (convention rooms fill the lower floors). The elevators are accessed by typing your destination on a master pad, which then directs you to an elevator that is programmed to take you to the floor. Efficient, but confusing to everyone looking for buttons to push.The staff at check-in is quick and efficient, although rooms were not available until 3 pm (people linger until noon before leaving). The room, on the 14th floor, was a corner room with a huge comfortable bed, large sitting area, and large bathroom. There weren't as many windows as might be expected, and there was a lot of wind noise. The room has a 'fridge, small mini-bar, flat-screen cable TV, and in-room coffee. There is wired internet access that keys to your computer, so if you have two machines in the room, you cant' swap the connection. The tub-shower is great, with good hot water and pressure.There are many good restaurants within easy walking distance, and convenience and package stores for drinks and snacks. "Restaurant Row" is a good destination for a wide variety of dining at reasonable prices, it is an easy two-block walk from the hotel. Many Broadway shows are similarly within a block or two, and the TKTS half-price office is just across the street at the center of Times Square.At checkout, allow a half hour for your bags to be transferred to the breezeway if you are ordering a cap. They take the bags in the lobby, and assume that you will linger before appearing to pick them up downstairs.This is a high-end property that is ideally located and appointed. The staff does a great job moving a large flow of people through the hotel, and is eager to help. Recommended!

Oct 29 2008 	Nice hotel but busy location.	The hotel was very nice and it was in the middle of Times Square. I did like our room, double beds and a nice view. Didn't like the elevators and how much you have to pay for internet! The housekeeper always came early like 8AM. If I had to choose what hotel, I wouldn't stay here at all. It's always busy and the lobby is located on the 8th floor.

Oct 26 2008 	One of the WORST we've stayed at	The Marriott Marquis is one of the worst hotels we've stayed at and does NOT justify the price at all! The room and bathroom were small and old. Oct 22 2008 	Loved this hotel	We loved this hotel. We had requested a king bed, but at check in were originally given a room with 2 double beds. Oct 22 2008	Fantastic - do not stay anywhere else in NYC	I took a chance and booked this on Priceline. What a great decision. This property is on Broadway between 45 and 46. Oct 21 2008 	Location Location Location	This hotel isn't near Times Square, it IS Times Square. As others have reviewed, this hotel is massive and extremely busy, Just like NYC! Despite the size and activity, rooms were relaxing and quiet. You have access to everything at this location. Theaters, Tours, food, and public transportation. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Now for a total contradiction. I stayed here for free by cashing in some hard earned Marriott Reward Points. The Marquis was the same point total as some lesser marriott's in the area so it made sense. Would I spend $400-$500 a night of my money to stay here? The answer is no. Oct 20 2008 	My first trip to NYC - the Marquis helped make it great!	My boyfriend and I just returned from the Marriott Marquis last night and had a great stay! The purpose for our tirp to New York was that we attended Wine Spectator's California Wine Experience event which was taking place at the hotel - so for convenience sake - we decided to stay at the Marquis. Glad we did!Our check in took a little bit, but it was because we had requested a Times Square view but the only beds available were two double and my boyfriend and I wanted a king. So - we opted for a king room that was available immediately that overlooked Broadway. This room was great! We had the last room at the end of the hall (3224) king bed and a little sitting area with a sofa bed. Very roomy! The bath was small and it was a little tough for both of us to get ready there at the same time.The room look like it had been updated somewhat recently - at least with the furnishings, carpet and the bedding - but it was tired in a few areas. There was a large flat-panel TV that we never turned on and a desk and chair if you're doing a little work as well. I think they charge $17/day for the internet - which I think is a bit excessive - but that's just my opinion.The window was on the small side too, but we looked directly out at the Virgin store and just to the right is 1 Times Square where they drop the ball on New Year's Eve. Needless to say, we were happy with the room and stayed even after the front desk called to say they had a Times Square view become available.I suppose I should back up the bus a bit and say this hotel is HUGE! Something like 2000 rooms and you can tell that by going to the elevator bank where there are 15 elevators! Crazy! We never really waited all that long, but there were a couple of occasions where we were jammed into a elevator with too many people - I'm sure we looked like circus clowns getting out of a VW a few times...Anyway, the lobby is on the 8th floor and that's where you'll find a Starbucks, shopping and a restaurant and bar. There is the View bar at the top (or close?) of the hotel and it moves....ever so slowly...but there was a line of probably 30 people waiting and it seemed to be a big hit. We had a few nice drinks but didn't eat so I can't comment on the food. There is also another Starbuck's on the first floor as well.The first floor let's you out in every direction, so it's nice you don't have to walk around an entire block to go in/out. Everything and anything you can think of that you want to see is in walking distance (this IS New York - so bring your comfortable walking shoes!!!!!!) The Lion King theatre is across the street, as is the one that Katie Holmes is starring in now. There were tons of people hoping for a Mr. and Mrs. Cruise sighting - so be prepared for larger than average crowds in front of this theatre!If you go out the Broadway door, maybe you'll get to see the Naked Cowboy! This is where he hangs out (ew!) and there is always quite a crowd around him as well.A quick tip....We had purchased a New York Pass and did the hop on/hop off CitySights open top bus tour - which is a bit corny but it was really nice. We also did the Circle Line cruise to the Statue of Liberty - that was very cool. If you intend on spending a few days going to several sights, I do recommend buying a pass. Our three-day pass got us into several museums, the bus rides, the cruise and the Empire State building - all included in one price. It was very handy.Back to the hotel....They did a great job with Wine Specator event - we were amazed at how quickly they transformed the ballroom spaces. The staff was professional and friendly and it didn't seem like we were "just another event" - so kudos to everyone.Some people have mentioned how busy the hotel is or how busy the streets are by the hotel. Um, this is TIMES SQUARE! If you want a peaceful, boutique-y stay....go to Tribeca. If you want to walk out your door and be in the thick of things....the Marquis is a great base camp for what I'm sure will be a great New York experience!Happy Travels!LisaMinneapolis

Oct 19 2008	If you want the buzz of NYC....stay here!	I've been to NY many times and nearly always stayed somewhere different. Oct 7 2008 	An "Experience"	Alright, this hotel was very good in some ways, but bad in others. Lets start with the bad. The hotel is extremely large and seems to be an epicentre for what is going on in Times Square. If you like to be in the middle of things, this hotel is fantastic, but if not, it is very crowded. With it being a large hotel, I was suprised to discover the lack of restauraunts. There was one marriott cafe that closed at 8:30 (NOT HELPFUL, especially after wanting as much time out in NY as possible) and an extremely over priced show case restauraunt on top of the hotel, that revolved around in useless circles so that you could see NY, but really you could see nothing. The food served there was probably worth a quarter of the price charged, and had EXTREMELY slow service, which the waiter gave me attitude about and blamed in on another large group. Needless to say, I am an Australian and am not used to leaving tips at the best of times, so this guy was not going well. After that "experience" I left a very small tip and never went back. Be careful as they try to pull the trick of putting an AUTOMATIC 18%!!!!!!! surcharge on the bill if u have more than 4 people. We had 5, so the $500 bill for the trash we ate went up t0 590. Rediculous! Moving on. Being a large hotel, service was lacking slightly, and it took a long time to get anything. Putting that aside, it was a top quality Marriott. The room I stayed in was newly furnished, with new TV and had a fantastic view over times square. Saying that, LOCATION LOCATION BABY!!!! This hotel is fantastc. Right in the middle of everything, walk out the door and Times Square just hits you. A great place. So, to wrap it up. A busy hotel, but to expected in Times Square, bad food in typical marriott fashion, but a irreplacable location and a great room. It definately was an experience I will never forget.

Sep 18 2008 	A great first NYC experience	We stayed here over a long weekend in early April '08. Check in was fast and stress-free (there was a line when we arrived but it moved quickly) and the staff was very welcoming. Our room was ready right away (well before the official check in time), and was clean and spacious, very little to argue with there. There's several food options there if you feel like staying in at any point on your trip -- we ate at the restaurant on the top floor (which was decent but expensive), as well as one of the restaurants on a lower floor for breakfast and the lounge for drinks (again, both were good and the revolving lounge is fun, but both, like many places in NYC, are a little pricey.) Sep 13 2008 	Unimpressed	If you are looking for a relaxing, friendly, classy hotel, this is not the place you should stay. I really has no class at all, basically just "casino" carpets everywhere, large unmemorable rooms with bad lighting and a really confusing elevator system that jams up on the bottom floor often. Sep 7 2008 	What a Great Stay!	I have returned from a short trip to New York City recently and I must say that the Marriot Marquis was a great choice for our trip. I took my 11 year old son and he, too, enjoyed this trip even though we were not near a beach. The room was fabulous and spacious and clean. The hotel picturesof their rooms on the websites are true to what we had. Our view overlooking Times Square was very scenic--everything that I have seen in so many television images. I found that evey staff member I came in contact with was very polite,service oriented as well as helpful. My only problem I had was not enough hot water for my shower one day, but with so many guests, I was not surprised and did not have the problem any other time.
